qas.question: The armed forces has approximately how many members?
Who is the highest ranking member of the Armed Forces?

answers.text: the Chief of the Defence Staff

qas.question: Who appoints the Chief of the Defence?
What location does the National Defense operate out of?
What are some of the members of the Armed Forces Council?

answers.text: the heads of the Royal Canadian Navy, the Canadian Army, the Royal Canadian Air Force and other key Level 1 organizations.

qas.question: The rallied forces has approximately how many members?
Who is the highest ranking member of the non-Armed Forces?
Who doesn't appoint the Chief of the Defence?

plausible_answers.text: Royal Canadian Navy, the Canadian Army, the Royal Canadian Air Force

qas.question: What are some of the members of the Non-Armed Forces Council?

context: The Armed Forces' <a0_0><b5_0>115,349<b5_0/><a0_0/> personnel are divided into a hierarchy of numerous ranks of officers and non-commissioned members. <a2_0>The governor general<a2_0/> appoints, on the advice of the prime minister, <a1_0>the <b6_0>Chief of the Defence Staff<b6_0/><a1_0/> (CDS) as the highest ranking commissioned officer in the Armed Forces and who, as head of the Armed Forces Council, is in command of the Canadian Forces. The Armed Forces Council generally operates from National Defence Headquarters (NDHQ) in <a3_0>Ottawa, Ontario<a3_0/>. On the Armed Forces Council sit the heads of Canadian Joint Operations Command and Canadian Special Operations Forces Command, the Vice Chief of the Defence Staff, and <a4_0>the heads of the <b8_0>Royal Canadian Navy, the Canadian Army, the Royal Canadian Air Force<b8_0/> and other key Level 1 organizations.<a4_0/> The sovereign and most other members of the Canadian Royal Family also act as colonels-in-chief, honorary air commodores, air commodores-in-chief, admirals, and <b7_0>captains-general<b7_0/> of Canadian Forces units, though these positions are ceremonial.
